tool_description: An API that retrieves data relating to areas of Australia collected and processed by Microburbs. Data is available on the area's house prices, education levels, crime rates and much more.
name: Microburbs (Test)
title: Microburbs (Test)

api_list.name: Areas
api_list.description:
Gets either:
- What areas of the level of the scope are contained within a passed in area 
- The names of areas from the scope  the passed in area is within
region refers to the region level (e.g. lga)  of the passed in area name and scope refers to the region level of the areas that the call will find.  For example with the query area_name=Melbourne region_level=lga scope=state the API gets the state Melbourne in within ('Victoria). Alternatively, the query with area_name=Melbourne region_level=sa2 scope=state will return all sa2s within the lga of Melbourne.
Returns a list of:
- The area name, region level and scope passed into the query.
-  One of found areas that fits the scope

required_parameters.name: scope
required_parameters.description: The region level of the areas being searched for

required_parameters.name: area_name
required_parameters.description: The name of the area to get the area it's within or the areas apart of it.

optional_parameters.name: region
optional_parameters.description: The region level of the area passed into area_name. Required if area_name is not a state

api_list.name: Fields
api_list.description:
Get the names of fields. Can filter by section and topic .
If you want fields available for sa1 level data pass in true for the sa1 parameter.
Every figure is the value of a field in an area. (e.g. The value of census_population in the SaL Melbourne is 47000) and every field has a topic and section.
Returns:
- The id of the field, which is used when querying for figures in figures endpoints.
- The section and topic that the field belongs to.
- The name of the field
- The region level the field belongs to. Every field id is unique to a region level (census_population only exists at the sal level)
- A defintion of what that field is, if avaliable.
- The Premium level of a feature

required_parameters.name: topic
required_parameters.description: Every section and field is a part of a a topic.

optional_parameters.name: sa1
optional_parameters.description: True if you want fields for sa1 level data

api_list.name: Figure All Level 1
api_list.description:
Gets the latest and previous values of a figure from an area.
Only gets figures of premium Level 1. Use GET fields endpoint to view the level of a field.
Field and area_name are required.
For each figure returns:
- The details passed into the query (area_name and field)
- The region_level the figure belongs to
- The date the figure was recorded
- The value of the figure
- The rank amongst other areas.
- The number of areas that it is being compared to in rank.

required_parameters.name: area_name
required_parameters.description: The area name to get the figures for.

required_parameters.name: field
required_parameters.description: The id of the field that the figures belong to (e.g census_population)

api_list.name: Figures All Trial
api_list.description:
Get some figures for free from some of Australia's top suburbs: Bondi,  Sydney,  South Yarra,  Melbourne, Box Hill (Vic.).
Gets the latest and previous values of a figure from one of those area.
Only gets figures of premium Level 1. Use GET fields endpoint to view the level of a field.
Field and area_name are required.
For each figure returns:

    The details passed into the query (area_name and field)
    The region_level the figure belongs to
    The date the figure was recorded
    The value of the figure
    The rank amongst other areas.
    The number of areas that it is being compared to in rank.

required_parameters.name: area_name
required_parameters.description: The area name to get the figures for.

required_parameters.name: field
required_parameters.description: The id of the field that the figure belongs to (e.g census_population)

api_list.name: Figures Latest Trial
api_list.description:
Get some figures for free from some of Australia's top suburbs: Bondi,  Sydney,  South Yarra,  Melbourne, Box Hill (Vic.).
Gets the latest value of a figure in one of those areas.
Only gets figures of premium Level 1. Use GET fields endpoint to view the level of a field.
Field and area name are required.
Returns:
- The details passed into the query (area_name and field)
- The region_level the figure belongs to
- The date the figure was recorded
- The value of the figure
- The rank amongst other areas.
- The number of areas that it is being compared to in rank.

required_parameters.name: area_name
required_parameters.description: The area name to get the figures for.

required_parameters.name: field
required_parameters.description: The id of the field that the figure belongs to (e.g census_population)

api_list.name: Figures All Level 3
api_list.description:
Gets the latest and previous values of a figure from an area.
Only gets figures of premium Level 3. Use GET fields endpoint to view the level of a field.
Field and area_name are required.
For each figure returns:
- The details passed into the query (area_name and field)
- The region_level the figure belongs to
- The date the figure was recorded
- The value of the figure
- The rank amongst other areas.
- The number of areas that it is being compared to in rank.

api_list.name: Multiple Figures Latest Level 1
api_list.description:
Get latest figures from an area filtered by a section and topic pair.
Only returns figures of Level 1. Individual calls are needed to get access to figures of higher levels.
area_name and section must be included.
region_level is required if the area is not a state.
For each figure returns:

The details passed into the query (area_name and field)
The region_level the figure belongs to
The date the figure was recorded
The value of the figure
The rank amongst other areas.
The number of areas that it is being compared to in rank.

optional_parameters.name: region_level
optional_parameters.description: Required if not state (e.g. sal, lga)

api_list.name: Sections
api_list.description:
Gets the names of Sections and the topics they are a part of.
Every field belongs to a section. 
A topic can be passed into filter out sections not belonging to that topic.

optional_parameters.name: topic
optional_parameters.description: The topic to get the sections from. Topics are broader categories that a section belongs to. (e.g. The Education section is a part of the Affluence topic)

api_list.name: Figures Latest Level 3
api_list.description:
Gets the latest value of a figure in an area.  
Only gets figures of premium Level 3. Use GET fields endpoint to view the level of a field.
 Field and area name are required.
Returns:
- The details passed into the query (area_name and field)
- The region_level the figure belongs to
- The date the figure was recorded
- The value of the figure
- The rank amongst other areas.
- The number of areas that it is being compared to in rank.

For each figure returns:

- The region_level the figure belongs to
- The date the figure was recorded
- The value of the figure
- The rank amongst other areas.
- The number of areas that it is being compared to in rank.

api_list.name: Figures Latest Level 2
api_list.description:
Gets the latest value of a figure in an area.  
Only gets figures of premium Level 2. Use GET fields endpoint to view the level of a field.
 Field and area name are required.
Returns:

api_list.name: Region Levels
api_list.description:
Returns the region levels that an area can be apart of. A region level is an area's type (Victoria is a state) and usually relates to its size. Some area names are repeated across region levels.
SaL (Suburbs and Locality) is the region level with the most figures assosciated with it.
To learn more about region levels are their sizes see the About tab.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://microburbs-test.p.rapidapi.com/region_levels"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "microburbs-test.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:

url = "https://microburbs-test.p.rapidapi.com/region_levels"

print(response.json())

api_list.name: Topics
api_list.description:
Gets the names of all topics. 
Topics are borad categories and the parents of sections.
